summary: As a Machine Learning Specialist - Data Scientist, you will need to have strong programming skills and strong understanding of data science and Machine Learning…
description: Data Scientist - Machine Learning Specialist - Montral, QC - Indeed.com Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData Scientist - Machine Learning SpecialistGroom & Associes20 reviewsGroom & Associes20 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Montral, QCOur client is an international telecommunications organization, dedicated to enabling their customers to thrive and prosper. They are looking for Data Scientists  Machine Learning Specialists to join their dedicated AI lab based in Montreal. Title: Data Scientist  Machine Learning Specialist Location: Montreal, QC Salary: Extremely competitive + benefits package + pension plan TO APPLY: Please send your resume to Emily at emily.woods@groomassocies.com As a Machine Learning Specialist - Data Scientist, you will need to have strong programming skills and strong understanding of data science and Machine Learning tools. You will use your knowledge and/or experience in Data Science methodologies apply them to solve challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. You will work in a highly collaborative environment where you communicate and plan tasks and ideas. You will be working on high impact initiatives with other DS in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability. Your contribution will also help to create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses. Responsibilities: Conduct functional and technical analysis within the organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities Contribute to rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solution addressing these needs. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed. Collaborate with product development teams and partners in the organization to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of the offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within the organization. Assist MI Competence build-up in the organization. Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MIs needs Requirements: MS, or PhD in Electrical Engineer, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, or related field Applied experience: 2+ years of Machine Learning experience in data science. title: Lead Data Scientist - NLP
summary: Our Flow-Equity team is looking for a passionate, innovative Data Scientist to spearhead the efforts of creating an equity trading model using NLP techniques.
description: Lead Data Scientist - NLP - Montral, QC - Indeed.ca Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchLead Data Scientist - NLPDRWMontral, QCDRW is a diversified, technology-led principal trading firm. We trade our own capital at our own risk, across a broad range of asset classes, instruments and strategies, in markets around the world. As the markets have evolved over the past 25 years, so has DRW  growing to include real estate, cryptocurrencies, venture capital and several industry acquisitions. With more than 800 employees at our Chicago headquarters and six global offices, we work together to solve interesting problems and capture opportunities. It's a place of high expectations, deep curiosity, and constant collaboration, with some of the smartest, most passionate people you'll meet. Our Flow-Equity team is looking for a passionate, innovative Data Scientist to spearhead the efforts of creating an equity trading model using NLP techniques. As a member of this team, you have the opportunity to build a state-of-the-art and evolving trading strategy from inception to completion in a growth-oriented environment that champions disruptiveness and embraces failures on the way to success. What you'll be working on Conducting cutting edge research to develop, implement, and perfect NLP algorithms for text/language/speech processing and sentiment analysis Applying quantitative techniques to large market datasets to obtain actionable insights and execute on them in real time Collaborating with internal Trade Execution, Data Acquisition, and Quantitative Research experts to build a next generation trading engine Building a world-class team of experts as required; striving to reach ambitious quantifiable long term goals, while presenting intermediate achievements Being a leading ML authority within the firm; staying at the forefront of the newest technologies, prototypes, and being proactive in ML communities Provide mentorship to your peers You'll feel right at home if you Have 5+ years of applied experience in ML and NLP Preferably have experience in the financial industry with sound knowledge of investment concepts Have expert understanding of machine learning techniques; knowledge of packages such as Tensorflow, Pytorch, Keras, Scikit Learn, Mat-plotlib, XGBoost Have good knowledge of deep learning and more traditional machine learning algorithms Have experience with embeddings, transfer learning, and interpretability methods Have working knowledge of cloud computing such as AWS and Google Cloud Have the ability to build, validate, deploy and monitor iteratively advanced predictive models Have excellent scripting and programming skills (such as Python, SQL) Have experience in conducting ML/NLP projects Have a positive, team-focused attitude and strong collaboration skills Have excellent written and communication skills to present complete and cohesive findings Have the ability to produce clear, logical and convincing arguments and explain complex ideas simply For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice ( https://drw.com/privacy-notice ).DRW - 30+ days ago - save job - report job - original jobApply NowApply On Company Sitesave this job aSave this jobLead Data Scientist jobs in Montral, QCJobs at DRW in Montral, QCLead Data Scientist salaries in Montral, QCCompany InfoFollowGet job updates from DRW. summary: Contobox is looking for a Data Scientist to work on our proprietary Engagement Management Platform. Our data pipeline and ETL micro-services process hundreds of…
description: Data Scientist - Montral, QC - Indeed.ca Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData ScientistContoboxMontral, QCContobox is looking for a Data Scientist to work on our proprietary Engagement Management Platform. If you have a good understanding of Machine Learning, have experience and love extracting valuable insights from big and diverse data sets, we'd be more than happy to invite you to be part of our team and together get our platform to the next level! Contobox EMP is built and operates around these three pillars: ENGAGE - collect 1st party data on users' preferences, score interest level in brand's products and services by engaging with users in interactive advertising units and websites. LEARN - use Audience Book and integrations with Data Management Platforms to learn brand's audiences by analyzing user interactions, understanding who those users are (gender, age, profession), what they like (interest levels, behaviors) and context that influenced engagements (publisher content, geolocation, current weather, season, time of day, etc). ACTIVATE - use the collected data and learnings to personalize user experiences and deliver the right message to the right audiences. Our data pipeline and ETL micro-services process hundreds of millions of records and your role as a Data Scientist will be to use Machine Learning and AI to achieve the following objectives: Analyzing factors affecting user preferences and motivating them to engage, learn about and buy brand's products Evaluating the relationship between different creative versions and user audience buckets and optimizing dynamic creatives in real-time Producing models that will forecast the performance of advertising campaigns Visualizing paths to conversions based on different KPIs and providing automated recommendations Marketing analysis of brand audiences and data activation on both proprietary and third-party DMPs (Data Management Platforms) and CDPs (Customer Data Platforms) Requirements Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.) At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modeling Deep understanding of predictive modeling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms Fluency in a programming language (Python, SQL, GoLang) Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Hadoop, Spark), database technologies (Amazon Redshift, Athena, MySQL, NoSQL) and cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud) . Working in an online advertising/marketing company or recommendation systems is a valuable asset. Benefits You will collaborate with a group of co-workers and clients who are all extremely dedicated and passionate about what they do. There are incentive systems in form of bonuses based on peer-to-peer recognition and company performance. The health insurance package is incredible, and there is a personal spending credit provided for fitness and health-related expenses. The office environment is inviting. You will work in a modern office located in a trendy area of Montreal where we : play ping-pong; have soccer tournaments on Xbox; consume snacks, enjoy coffee and drink beer; have office lunches and engage in different team activities.Contobox - 30+ days ago - save job - report job - original jobApply NowApply Nowsave this job aSave this jobData Scientist jobs in Montral, QCJobs at Contobox in Montral, QCData Scientist salaries in Montral, QCCompany InfoFollowGet job updates from Contobox. title: Lead AI Data Scientist
summary: ETL Analysis, Data Profiling, Data Quality Analysis, Data Quality Assessment, Source Data Analysis, Source to Target mapping). WHY SHOULD YOU BE INTERESTED?
description: Lead AI Data Scientist - Montral, QC - Indeed.ca Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchLead AI Data ScientistSITA323 reviewsSITA323 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Montral, QCProfession: Solution Development Work Location: Americas-Canada-Montreal Schedule:Full-time Description ABOUT US Welcome to SITA... We lead one of the most exciting and advanced industries on earth. Around the world, nearly every passenger flight relies on SITA technology, almost every airport and airline does business with us, and its our job to support their operations. As the world's leading air transport IT and communications specialist, were committed to meeting the demands of the air transport industry around the clock, every day. Our Vision: Easy air travel every step of the way WHY SHOULD YOU BE INTERESTED? With us there are no limits for people looking to explore the edges of possibility and beyond. Together, we Go.Far. Challenge: Our people take on some of the biggest challenges in our industry. They aren't afraid to think bigger, work harder and deliver smarter solutions that are continuously transforming air travel. Opportunity: Taking on these challenges opens up a world of opportunities for our people. We make sure they have the chance to develop their skills, explore new horizons and grow their careers on a global scale. BENEFITS IN CANADA: Competitive medical, dental, and vision plans RRSPs with company matching contributions Life and disability insurance Incentive based wellness program Stand by Buddy Pass Travel Note that these benefits can change and some of these benefits have conditions and may not apply to all employees. THE ROLE: The future of Air Transportation Industry is being built today and AI is on the forefront. SITA is making that future more productive, more secure and more sustainable. We are harnessing the power of cloud, data science, AI, and user design thinking to deliver on the promise of intelligent data products data solutions that will help increase industry collaboration and deliver seamless passenger journey in ways that make Easy Air Travel Every Step of The Way  and together lets move the world. You will be part of the company global Data Science & AI CoE and you will be working with stakeholders by Agile and Design Thinking Methodologies, innovating and improving ATI industry with Data Science AI Technology. Together with the CoE you will deliver everything from state-of-the-art solutions to quicker value proving solutions. You will be responsible for developing and deployment state-of-the-art Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) solutions for the Air Transportation Industry, smarter passenger journey, smarter bag journey smart experience and smart enterprises in the digital solutions business of SITA. You will be solving complex industrial problems using advanced AI techniques with involvement in the designing, software engineering, productization and deployment of AI solutions You will be a member of a talented team that delivers contemporary AI solutions for all SITA Product Business. You will be executing AI software engineering projects as we build out capabilities and our architecture Qualifications BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Strong quantitative and analytical expertise that covers statistics, machine learning/deep learning/data mining, experimentation methodology Multiple years of advanced hands-on experience in leading advanced analytics tools such as Python (SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, Keras etc) , R, SPSS, SAS or MATLAB Proficiency in C/C++, Python Java or similar platform Familiarity with deep learning, classical machine learning, statistics Multiple years of hands-on experience in conducting analyses on structured / semi-structured as well as unstructured data (e.g. ETL Analysis, Data Profiling, Data Quality Analysis, Data Quality Assessment, Source Data Analysis, Source to Target mapping) Experience with emerging large-scale Big Data analytics tools (such as the Apache Hadoop Ecosystem, Apache Spark/MLlib, Apache Mahout and the like) will be a strong advantage Experience in advanced analytics use cases in one or more dedicated industries Strong communication skills and business acumen, including a feeling for data visualization and experience in presenting complex information to business stakeholders in a compelling way Familiarity with digital design, digital hardware architectures (CPU, GPU, NPU, SoC) is a plus Configuring, coding, developing, and documenting software specifications throughout the project life cycle Neural Networks, Deep Learning, Convolutional Networks, Recurrent Network, Machine Learning Mapping neural networks to custom hardware Real-time embedded software/firmware development, Linux kernel/device drivers, system level simulation and optimization Software maintenance and source control (Subversion, Git), bug tracking (Jira, Bugzilla), and collaboration (Confluence, MoinMoin) REQUIRED TECHNICAL AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERTISE: MS or PhD in Computer Science or Artificial Intelligence. Experience in natural language understanding, computer vision, machine learning, algorithmic foundations of optimization, data mining, or machine intelligence. Strong experience in agent based intelligent control systems and reinforcement learning. Proficiency in one or more of the following languages: C, C++, Python, Java. Experience with implementing numerical methods and data visualization. Strong experience in algorithm design, AI related algorithms implementation including A* search, Monte Carlo tree search, MiniMax search (Alpha Beta Pruning), Admissible Heuristics for optimal planning. Hands-on in symbolic programming, eventbased system design. Experience in software development of multi-threaded, scalable and highly-available distributed systems. Strong computer science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, high-performance computing, algorithm design and problem solving. Knowledge of software engineering practices and best practices for software development. Extensive experience implementing numerical and/or machine learning algorithms. Ability to translate abstract algorithm descriptions into software requirements, design specifications, and implementations. Experience in developing and leveraging AI techniques, such as machine learning, NLP, knowledge induction, machine reasoning, etc. Experience in analyzing large scale data from a variety of sources. Experience in design, validation, and characterization of algorithms and/or systems. Experience in design and implement high quality software for AI algorithms developed by AI Data Scientists for deployment. Proficiency in deep learning and machine learning algorithms and deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Pytorch Keras, and Caffe. At least 3 years experience as a Development/Release Engineer At least 3 years experience with shell scripts, Docker and Jenkins Experience in software development of multi-threaded, scalable and highly-available distributed systems. Strong computer science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structures, high-performance computing, algorithm design and problem solving. Knowledge of software engineering practices and best practices for software development. Extensive experience implementing numerical and/or machine learning algorithms. Ability to translate abstract algorithm descriptions into software requirements, design specifications, and implementations. Experience in developing and leveraging AI techniques, such as machine learning,deep learning NLP, knowledge induction, machine reasoning, etc. Experience in analyzing large scale data from a variety of sources. Excellent communication skills SITA is an Employment Equity Employer and values a diverse workforce. In support of our Employment Equity Program, women, Aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply and self-identify in the application process. #LI-LC1 Job Posting: Apr 9, 2019, 10:30:58 AMSITA - 30+ days ago - save job - report job - original jobApply NowApply On Company Sitesave this job aSave this jobLead Data Scientist jobs in Montral, QCJobs at SITA in Montral, QCLead Data Scientist salaries in Montral, QCCompany InfoFollowGet job updates from SITA. description: Data Scientist - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData ScientistThe Economical Insurance Group85 reviewsThe Economical Insurance Group85 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Vancouver, BCWHY ECONOMICAL? Because a changing industry calls for a new way of doing things. An ambitious, innovative and fast-paced company, we offer exceptional training and development programs, competitive pay, great benefits, a company-matched savings plan, and paid volunteer days  all within an engaging, fun, and collaborative work environment. Founded more than 145 years ago, Economical is one of Canadas leading property and casualty insurance companies. We rely on our national network of more than 800 independent brokers to sell a range of car, home, business, and farm insurance solutions. With Sonnet and Petline, were extending our reach through the direct-to-customer channel. With more than 2,400 active employees across the country and a commitment to rethinking the insurance experience, were poised for great things. Were now adding to our high-performance team to take us into the future. Lets rethink insurance, together. ** This position is available to candidates in Waterloo, Toronto, Vancouver or Montreal ** In this role, you will: Have responsibility for developing advanced pricing models, researching the latest new methods being used in data science and help us stay ahead of our competitors. This opportunity will expose you to the world of analytics and actuarial science. Your Responsibilities Collection and aggregation of both structured and unstructured data from multiple sources Maintenance of existing data collection and reporting solutions Transformation of datasets to suit modelling, reporting and other purposes Build predictive models to predict insurance cost, customer demand and other more complex problems Perform validation and due diligence checks to assess data integrity Procure requested data for the analytics and actuarial teams Automate repetitive processes Your Skills and Experience University degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Actuarial Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance/Business) Understanding of statistical methods Excellent communication and organizational skills 1-3 years of SAS or SQL programming experience 1-3 years of R or Python programming experience Knowledge of Emblem or Radar an asset Preference will be given to candidates with GLM and other modeling experience At Economical, we all work together to come up with big ideas  then bring them to life. We focus on our customers first, we bring our best, and were stronger together. If youve got the passion and the desire to help us reinvent insurance, lets talk. HOW TO APPLY To complete the online application process, youll need to upload your resume before you apply for the role youre interested in. Please note that only one document can be uploaded, so be sure to combine your resume and cover letter. We are committed to providing an inclusive work environment that welcomes diversity and supports accessibility across the organization. With the help of our dedicated team, we offer more than a renowned luxury product, we create life changing experiences. We are looking for positive people who bring a passion for excellence and commitment to teamwork to join us. Rocky Mountaineer is proud to work with a strong team of talented individuals. We were recently named one of Deloittes Best Managed Companies and have won Employer of the Year by the Tourism Industry Association of Canada multiple times. We are expanding our Research & Analytics Team! We are seeking an ambitious Junior Data Scientist, who can blend their skills in statistics, programming, consulting, business analysis, analytics & storytelling (yes, were looking for a unicorn) to maximize value and utilization from Rocky mountaineers rich data resources. The ideal candidate will be an ambitious self-starter with a background in solving complex problems using a variety of methods and data sources. This role is responsible for developing analytics that identify opportunities to make Rocky Mountaineer better for our guests and partners. Were looking for people with a proven track record dealing with large, complex and unstructured data and distilling it to meaningful insights that inspire powerful actions. Market/Customer Analytics Performing complex analytics and statistical modelling on large data sets to identify market/business sector trends, customer buying patterns, etc. to inform business, product development, and marketing decisions Data Science/Analytics and BI Generalist Requirement gathering, scoping, and development of analytical products for multiple departments Develops, analyzes and models data to quantify the competitive performance of business segments, evaluate potential operational changes, and designs new approaches and methodologies Analyzes organizational data to recommend solution to an organization problem, models and evaluates the potential impact of changes, and report findings to the business Applies and integrates statistical, mathematical, predictive modeling and business analysis skills to manage and manipulate complex high volume data from a variety of sources Business Intelligence Data Analysis Blending historical data from available industry reports, public information, field reports or purchased sources as input to analyses Identifying and analyzing industry/geographic trends and competitor market strategies and monitoring current/potential customer trends Partners with other areas of the business (e.g., Marketing, Logistics, Customer Service, etc.) to model the outcome of implementing potential business strategies You will be responsible for.. Working closely with business leaders to determine how business intelligence tools/solutions can drive value and efficiency. Working collaboratively with Research, Analytics, IT and business teams to provide insights and data-driven recommendations for Rocky Mountaineer. Asking and answering difficult questions in complex datasets, and ability to communicate to a wide audience of analytics professionals, business stakeholders, managers and executives. Working in a multi-disciplined team where youll help turn discoveries and ideas into machine learning models. Supporting the improvement of guest experience by leveraging your knowledge in via A/B testing, segmentation, clustering and other statistical/machine learning methods. Actively contribute to taking Data Science at Rocky Mountaineer to the next level You will have Masters Degree in Business Analytics, Operations Research, Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Chemistry, Psychology, Mathematics or Statistics 2+ years hands of experience in business application of advanced analytics and data mining including predictive algorithms Strong programming skills in Python, SQL and/or Scala, Java Strong facility with R, Matlab, SAS or similar Self-motivated, curious and proactive, with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities and an innate drive to improve how things work Ability to perform verbal and visual storytelling with data with a talent for making the numbers, measures and targets come alive. Able to work independently and multitask under short deadlines based on general directions If this position suits your skills, experience and personal attributes, we want to talk to you! Please apply by submitting your resume and a cover letter outlining why you are a suitable candidate. Armstrong Group is committed to equal opportunity employment and invites applications from all qualified candidates. Please note that background checks are a part of our hiring process. title: Data Scientist
summary: 3+ years relevant work experience Data Engineer or Data Science. Databases & Data Management (e.g., SQL, NoSQL ).
description: Data Scientist - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData ScientistBOEING6,779 reviewsBOEING6,779 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Vancouver, BCBoeing Vancouver houses an eclectic group of passionate data scientists who help customers by making sense out of big, complex systems in the world of aviation. We combine deep scientific thinking, mathematical prowess and analytics technology with creativity and detective work to uncover rare insights hidden within the data. We harness practical knowledge of engineering, business, and aviation to build customer solutions. Together, we deliver the power of understanding to change the world above and on the ground. Position Responsibilities: We are looking for skilled, inquisitive analysts to bring the fast-growing, ever-evolving power of data science to aviation and aerospace. As a Data Scientist, you will have to combine the skills of a developer and a detective, drawing on a wide palette of mathematics, statistics, machine learning, and programming techniques to unravel mysteries too subtle for the naked eye. You will get to work closely with our customers, building their trust, studying their problems and business needs, and you will blend artistry with science to visualize and explain your findings and stories. We want you to invent new ways of doing things, and to contribute your own specialties to problem-solving teams of diverse backgrounds. We want you to help us craft and launch leading-edge operational solutions around the world. Above all, we are seeking someone who will value and champion our culture of learning, trust, and relentless collaborative energy. We love breathing new science into the industry, and we love sharing the journey. We believe that thirst for knowledge and having fun go hand-in-hand. Does this sound like you? Come build Vancouvers local data science community with us and make a global impact. We Want to Hear From You If You are a technical jack-of-all-trades and master of one  uncommonly familiar with a wide array of data analytic techniques, applications, and programming languages; you know the methods, their strengths and weaknesses, and how to use the right tool for the job. But more than that, you possess uncommon or exceptional proficiency in at least one technical specialty (e.g. programming languages, statistical techniques, machine-learning analytics, web development, etc.) You are a business thinker  project-minded, down-to-earth and strategic. You focus on customers, their viewpoints and real-world priorities. You balance pragmatic choices, and you appreciate the robust elegance in the path of least resistance to a solution. And you stay always on the lookout for new problems and new possibilities for growth. You love learning  You dont rest on your laurels, and you enjoy honing your mind. You have diverse interests; you have fun learning new ideas, growing your skills and sharing the experience with others. You communicate and collaborate effectively you know how to collaborate in diverse teams both large and small. You can switch confidently between following and leading as circumstances dictate. You are respectful, honest, and you strive to understand as much as to be understood. Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience) 3+ years relevant work experience Data Engineer or Data Science Must be proficient in Python (special emphasis on Pandas) and SQL Must have experience in formal collaborative development environment and version control (e.g., Gitlab) Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience): Confident communication skills Critical-thinking skills (formal training in Kepner-Tregoe, Root-Cause Analysis, or similar) Project management knowledge (PMBOK, Agile, Kanban) is an asset Domain knowledge in the aviation & aerospace industry is an asset Expertise or specializations in the following areas: Statistics & Data Mining Forecasting & Time-series Analysis Signal Analysis Machine-learning or Artificial Intelligence Large-scale data analysis technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Cassandra, Pig, Hive) Simulation, Numerical Modeling Mathematical Optimization Visualization Techniques & Technology (e.g. Tableau, D3.js) Databases & Data Management (e.g., SQL, NoSQL ) Programming (e.g., Java, Python, R) Typical Education: Must have a Bachelors degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar technical discipline. description: Data Scientist, Capacity Forecasting - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData Scientist, Capacity ForecastingAMZN CAN Fulfillment Svcs, ULC38,092 reviewsAMZN CAN Fulfillment Svcs, ULC38,092 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Vancouver, BCBachelor's degree in Statistics, Applied Math, Operations Research, Economics, Engineering or a related quantitative field with at least 5 years of working experience as a Scientist or a Masters Degree with 3 years of working experience as a Scientist.Experience with statistical analysis, modeling, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, mining and demand modelingProficiency with /R or other web-based interfaces to create graphic-rich customizable plots, charts maps, etc.Experience using one or more R, , , C++, VBA, and other programming languagesExperience processing, filtering, and presenting large quantities of dataAble to write SQL scripts for analysis and reporting (Redshift, SQL, MySQL) Are you excited and passionate about delivering advanced analytics that directly influence the AWS S3 customer experience? Do you see yourself as a champion of innovating on behalf of the customer by turning insights into action? Come join AWS S3 Equilibrium team as Scientist in capacity forecasting and planning function. Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3) delivers storage for the Internet. It provides a simple web services interface that customers use to store and retrieve any amount of , at any time, from anywhere on the web. It gives them access to the same highly scalable, reliable, secure, fast, inexpensive infrastructure that Amazon itself uses to run its own global network of web sites. S3 processes peaks of over 60 Tbps of traffic in a day. We maximize benefits of our scale and pass them on to our customers. By doing this, were creating a fundamental shift in how businesses think about managing their storage needs. As part of this team, you will work with multiple AWS teams to help forecast the S3 webserver demand. You will be a creative problem solver who is obsessed with delivering the best customer experience, as well as, a highly analytical, team-oriented individual with excellent communication skills. You will get opportunity to write good quality code and innovate on behalf of our customers. You will work with the capacity planning team to keep multiple projects on task, track and achieve organizational goals, and plan team activities. You will be a face and voice for capacity forecasting and ensure all stakeholders are aware of successes, risks, and status. You will tailor your communications to specific audiences and communicate clearly and concisely to both business and technical audiences. Key Responsibilities Include Design and Build the forecasting approach for S3 frontend webserver capacityImprove upon existing methodologies by developing new sources, testing model enhancements, and fine-tuning model parameters.Responsible for building forecast models that provide an ongoing and timely forecast for capacity planning, including rolling forecasts with business grain, variance analysis, business adjustments, and KPIsBuild customer-facing reporting tools to provide insights and metrics which track forecast performance and explain varianceContribute to the overall product roadmap, and manage prioritization and trade-offs against customer experience. title: Data Scientist (Applied Statistics)
summary: Perform data validation, statistical analysis and modelling to analyze data collected from the biological studies; Experience with Python or R programming;
description: Data Scientist (Applied Statistics) - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.ca Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData Scientist (Applied Statistics)TerrameraVancouver, BCOVERVIEW We are actively seeking an ambitious, experienced and highly driven Data Scientist (Applied Statistics) to assist in the acceleration of our scientific work. As a key member of our Research and Development team, the Data Scientist (Applied Statistics) will work closely with our scientists and engineers to design experiments and deploy findings, analyses and models into production for scientific use. If you are someone who has a background in statistics as well as experience in experimental design- we want to hear from you! YOUR MISSION To collaborate with scientists for the purpose of experimental design, perform statistical analysis/machine learning modeling and communicate findings to the scientists to produce data-driven projects. To research and implement new methodologies to accelerate Terramera's bioscience research. ACCOUNTABILITIES Collaborate with scientists to design and execute experiments for biological studies, both in a lab setting and at greenhouses; Define experiment goals, identify factors and responses, choose appropriate study designs and calculate necessary sample sizes; Perform data validation, statistical analysis and modelling to analyze data collected from the biological studies; Prepare written and oral presentations that summarize data analysis results, interpret findings and provide recommendations; Implement analytical/ statistical strategies and research new methodologies in consultation with other experts; Develop machine learning and computation models for predictive analytics and prescriptive analytics; and Collaborate with Software and Machine Learning Engineers to deploy your models into production. REQUIREMENTS PhD. or MSc in Statistics, Biostatistics or related fields; Strong understanding of fundamental statistical concepts and methods; 2+ years' practical experience in experiment design, including power analysis, block design, factorial design, longitudinal design, and statistical analysis; and Experience with statistical learning / machine learning techniques and frameworks. PREFERENCES Accreditation in Statistics/Analytics; Experience with Python or R programming; Familiarity with agriculture field research, plant physiology and phenotyping; Good understanding of regulatory guidelines and requirements in agriculture field research; Familiarity with open-source biostatistics libraries and software; and Knowledge of the Agile project management methodology. QUALITIES WE'RE LOOKING FOR Aptitude for interdisciplinary collaboration; Highly conscientious with strong follow-through; Strong communication and critical thinking ability to influence and propose analytics strategies that challenge status quo thinking; Capable of performing research on best practices and communicating findings to a non-expert audience; and Able to apply domain knowledge to ambiguous and novel situations. LOCATION Vancouver, BC WHO WE ARE Terramera is a global leader in Technology for Clean Food with a mission to increase global yields while decreasing synthetic chemical loads, so we can grow affordable, clean food for everyone. We are committed to cultivating safe, healthy homes and environments, and developing highly effective natural products for consumers and farmers. Terramera uses technology to unlock the power in nature, so we can live healthier, make clean food affordable and feed the world. Our success begins with our people. We're looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team. description: Data Scientist - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.ca Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData ScientistArticle26 reviewsArticle26 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Vancouver, BCHey, were Article. Were a digital-first furniture brand thats engineering remarkably better furniture experiences. We dont have brick and mortar stores, so were able to deliver better value on beautiful, modern furniture. Recently named one of Canadas fastest growing companies, were on the hunt for talented, enthusiastic team members to join us at our headquarters in beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia. At Article, we are constantly looking to improve everything from the way we optimize our website used by millions of unique visitors a month to how we allocate a multi-million dollar marketing budget. We employ a variety of techniques ranging from simple A/B tests, structural time series modelling, and novel quasi-experiments to infer causality from mixed experimental and observational data. We are looking for a Data Scientist with knowledge of statistical modeling, causal inference, and experimentation methodology to join our team and help us shape the way we conduct experiments at Article. The ideal candidate will have experience working with or creating experimentation platforms (perhaps even in the context of the anonymous web) and designing experiments themselves. You will have significant ability to shape the direction of the experimentation program at Article while working alongside a talented team of data and engineering professionals. Research and develop new experimentation methods and predictive modeling techniques that will improve the efficiency and effectiveness of experiments. Work with engineers to improve our in-house experimentation platform and define metrics that will capture salient features of experiment goals. Work with strategic partners to define high-impact analytical problems and find innovative ways to solve them using data. Communicate experimental results to key business leaders and suggest ways to put the findings into operation. Requirements Advanced degree in Statistics, Economics, Operation Research or similar quantitative fields. Strong knowledge of statistical inference and experience in experimental design or causal inference. Fluent in one of Python or R. Comfortable in working with SQL. Ability to clearly communicate and translate technical results into actionable insights to a non-technical audience. Empathy for your audience and users and the ability to communicate effectively is critical to your success in this position. A great office. We supply state-of-the-art laptops and the software you need to succeed. Access to a benefits package with all the bells and whistles. Onsite fitness equipment, change rooms (including towel service!) and bike storage. Discounts on our products, plus free upgraded delivery so you can style your home how you like it. Regular extra-curricular activities, such as socials, open-mics, picnics... even cross-country skiing! Were open to suggestions for fun new activities so bring a few ideas along. description: Data Science / Machine Learning Engineer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.ca Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData Science / Machine Learning EngineerCisco Careers5,070 reviewsCisco Careers5,070 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Vancouver, BCWhat You'll Do As a Data Science/Machine Learning Engineer, you will: Design, build, evaluate, and operationalize models using the latest in AI/ML techniques to build meaningful solutions Be the analytical problem-solver and the catalyst that will help business teams make better decisions using data and analytics Bring an inter-disciplinary skillset of AI/ML/Data Science, Computer Science, Software Engineering, and Business Develop data products/services across descriptive, inquisitive and predictive analytics to improve business processes and drive tangible business outcomes Lead complex analytics programs, working with multi-functional teams Train other ML Engineers and educate Data Scientists on the Engineering side Above all, come with a curious mind and a passionate learning mindset Who You'll Work With We are building a best-in-class team of passionate, result oriented problem solvers with the aim of enabling better data-driven decisions and thereby creating business impact. We operate as a startup: work hard, learn every single day, focus on doing measurable and impactful work; and have lots of fun along the way Who You Are Do you thrive in a multi-tasking, rapid prototyping, and agile development environment? You bring the ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions. Good interpersonal skills are an important part of what you bring to this role. Our minimum requirements for this role: Masters, or PhD in computer science 2+ years of industry experience in an analytics/data scientist role doing machine learning, NLP, deep learning, preferably with some of that at a B2B company; proven knowledge with modern ML and Deep learning frameworks such as sklearn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, etc; proven track record in experimental design Excellent coding abilities in Python and SQL Solid knowledge in statistics, probability, data structures and algorithms Proficient in data analysis, data exploration, data wrangling and data validation Ability to communicate and explain complex algorithms and models to other data scientists and layman stakeholders Industry experience with cloud technologies, more specifically, GCP, Snowflakes, Teradata, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, SAP HANA Industry experience in prototyping and productizing analytics/data science results; experience with building microservices Bonus: Experience with container/orchestration technologies (Docker), schedulers (Airflow, MLFlow, KubeFlow), continuous integration workflows Experience with data warehousing and data integration tools Experience with visualization tools, e.g. Tableau or Qlik We Are Cisco #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Heres how we do it. We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Mission Statement The core mission of Amazon Web Services (AWS) Marketing is to educate customers about cloud computing and our services. Millions of customers engage with us every day across multiple channels. Imagine building a platform that enables AWS to speak to engineers, CTOs, CIOs, and CEOs, educate them about AWS services, and empower them on their journey to the cloud. Our services act as the foundation for announcing new AWS products and are uniquely positioned to redefine how our cloud community consumes information and engages with AWS. Overview Would you like to support increasing customer base and the revenue for AWS, a market-leading cloud offering? Would you like to be part of a team focused on increasing awareness and adoption of the AWS platform by analyzing customer's behavior on and outside AWS websites? Do you want to empower our AWS marketing team make data-driven decisions that further establish AWS as leader in the cloud computing world? As a Data Engineer at AWS, you will be working in a large, extremely complex and dynamic data warehousing environment. We are looking for someone with the uncanny ability to integrate multiple heterogeneous data sources like Adobe Site Catalyst, Adobe Target, Sales Force, Adobe Connect with AWS central data warehouse and build efficient, flexible, and scalable data warehouse and reporting solutions. You should be enthusiastic about learning new technologies and be able to implement solutions using these technologies to enable upgrades of the existing platform. You should have excellent business and communication skills and be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions, then build the data sets that answer those questions. You should be expert at designing, implementing, and operating stable, scalable, low cost solutions to flow data from production systems into the data warehouse and into end-user facing reporting applications. Above all you should be passionate about working with huge data sets and someone who loves to bring datasets together to answer business questions and drive growth. At AWS, you have control over every layer you build. Instead of owning a small slice of an existing service, you will own a core segment of a growing marketing platform serving 1000s of internal customers and millions of external customers. You will build on multiple AWS services and have opportunities to engage directly with those teams to improve our core offerings. At AWS, we work with our customers on a daily basis to prove out our ideas, gather feedback, and improve the platform. description: Research Associate, Nematology - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.ca Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchResearch Associate, NematologyTerrameraVancouver, BCTWO (2) FULL-TIME PERMANENT POSITIONS OVERVIEW We are currently seeking a qualified candidate with a background in Nematology to join our Research & Development team. This position will work closely with our Nematology Scientists and Screening Manager to plan, setup and assess bioassays. This position will also work closely with our Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientist to develop image-derived nematode evaluations in support of automated analysis of experimental results. YOUR MISSION To support the discovery and development of sustainable, safe and environmentally friendly nematode control products and apply our targeted delivery technologies by conducting high throughput in-vitro and in-planta nematode screening assays and greenhouse trials. RESPONSIBILITIES Plan and perform experiments in support of research projects at Terramera's lab/greenhouse/farm based on knowledge of scientific theory, interpreting and performing basic analyses of results; Conduct lab experiments both independently and collaboratively as a team, primarily using C. elegans and plant parasitic nematodes; Setup greenhouse experiments, including preparing soil/sand mixes, filling containers with soil/sand mixes and inoculating with nematodes; Nematode extraction and sample purification; Establish and maintain nematode colonies in greenhouse/farm; Assist with stock maintenance of C. elegans; Operate lab equipment, including microscopes, plate readers, centrifuges, incubators, autoclaves and pH meters; Develop, write and maintain Standard Operating Procedures (SOPS) in the nematology lab; and Support the training, mentoring and supervision of co-op students. REQUIREMENTS MSc in Nematology or related biological science; Good understanding and knowledge of nematology, soil science and soil ecosystems; Practical experience with C. elegans and plant parasitic nematodes; Proficiency with quantification and identification of plant parasitic nematodes is an advantage; Experience designing, executing, troubleshooting in-planta experiments; and Comfortable working with plants, soil and using microscopes. QUALITIES WE'RE LOOKING FOR Critical thinking ability; Strong interpersonal, communication and decision-making skills; Demonstrated ability in problem solving and working in a dynamic environment; Curiosity and creativity in meeting challenges and obstacles; Desire for interdisciplinary collaboration and openness to "out of the box" ideas; and Flexibility to work in accordance with the needs of experiments being performed. WHO WE ARE Terramera is a global leader in Technology for Clean Food with a mission to increase global yields while decreasing synthetic chemical loads, so we can grow affordable, clean food for everyone. We are committed to cultivating safe, healthy homes and environments, and developing highly effective natural products for consumers and farmers. Terramera uses technology to unlock the power in nature, so we can live healthier, make clean food affordable and feed the world. WHY US? Our goals are big, hairy and audacious. We're striving to reduce the use of toxic chemical pesticides by 80%, help increase global food production by 20% and positively impact a billion people by 2028. *** Terramera is committed to a diverse workforce and we are an equal opportunity employer. Our success begins with our people. We're looking for A-Players who are passionate about making a difference as we are and thrive in environments that are dynamic, challenging and rewarding. Join our movement, as we set a new standard and change the world together as a highly dedicated, innovative, future-focused and solutions-oriented team. While we thank all applicants for their interest, only short-listed candidates will be contacted. description: Data Scientist - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.ca Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData ScientistArticle26 reviewsArticle26 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Vancouver, BCHey, were Article. Were a digital-first furniture brand thats engineering remarkably better furniture experiences. We dont have brick and mortar stores, so were able to deliver better value on beautiful, modern furniture. Recently named one of Canadas fastest growing companies, were on the hunt for talented, enthusiastic team members to join us at our headquarters in beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia. At Article, we are constantly looking to improve everything from the way we optimize our website used by millions of unique visitors a month to how we allocate a multi-million dollar marketing budget. We employ a variety of techniques ranging from simple A/B tests, structural time series modelling, and novel quasi-experiments to infer causality from mixed experimental and observational data. We are looking for a Data Scientist with knowledge of statistical modeling, causal inference, and experimentation methodology to join our team and help us shape the way we conduct experiments at Article. The ideal candidate will have experience working with or creating experimentation platforms (perhaps even in the context of the anonymous web) and designing experiments themselves. You will have significant ability to shape the direction of the experimentation program at Article while working alongside a talented team of data and engineering professionals. Responsibilities and daily tasks include: Partner closely with stakeholders to design, implement, and analyze experiments that drive key product decisions. Research and develop new experimentation methods and predictive modeling techniques that will improve the efficiency and effectiveness of experiments. Work with engineers to improve our in-house experimentation platform and define metrics that will capture salient features of experiment goals. Work with strategic partners to define high-impact analytical problems and find innovative ways to solve them using data. Communicate experimental results to key business leaders and suggest ways to put the findings into operation. Requirements Advanced degree in Statistics, Economics, Operation Research or similar quantitative fields. Strong knowledge of statistical inference and experience in experimental design or causal inference. Fluent in one of Python or R. Comfortable in working with SQL. Ability to clearly communicate and translate technical results into actionable insights to a non-technical audience. Empathy for your audience and users and the ability to communicate effectively is critical to your success in this position. A great office. The Article space is housed in a converted warehouse with in-house photo studios, an airy open layout, an open kitchen filled with snacks, and a variety of ice cream choices just up the street. A dog-friendly office. We love our dog friends here at Article. If you have a well-behaved, well-socialized pup, wed love to have them in the office too. The tools you need to get your job done well! We supply state-of-the-art laptops and the software you need to succeed. Access to a benefits package with all the bells and whistles. Onsite fitness equipment, change rooms (including towel service!) and bike storage. Discounts on our products, plus free upgraded delivery so you can style your home how you like it. Regular extra-curricular activities, such as socials, open-mics, picnics... even cross-country skiing! Were open to suggestions for fun new activities so bring a few ideas along. description: Data Engineer II - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData Engineer IIAmazon Web Services Canada, In38,092 reviewsAmazon Web Services Canada, In38,092 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Vancouver, BCDegree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field and 5+ years industry experience.3+ years of relevant experience with ETL and data warehouse architectures.Experience implementing and validating ETL processes.Data profiling experience for large data sets in a data warehouse environment.Extensive knowledge of SQL query design, optimization, and verification.Proficiency in Python or another general-purpose scripting language.Understanding of Data Warehousing concepts and track record of applying these concepts on the job.Exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities.Experience building self-service reporting solutions using business intelligence software (e.g., Tableau, Amazon Quicksight, etc.). Mission Statement The core mission of Amazon Web Services (AWS) Marketing is to educate customers about cloud computing and our services. Millions of customers engage with us every day across multiple channels. Imagine building a platform that enables AWS to speak to engineers, CTOs, CIOs, and CEOs, educate them about AWS services, and empower them on their journey to the cloud. Our services act as the foundation for announcing new AWS products and are uniquely positioned to redefine how our cloud community consumes information and engages with AWS. Overview Would you like to support increasing customer base and the revenue for AWS, a market-leading cloud offering? Would you like to be part of a team focused on increasing awareness and adoption of the AWS platform by analyzing customer's behavior on and outside AWS websites? Do you want to empower our AWS marketing team make data-driven decisions that further establish AWS as leader in the cloud computing world? As a Data Engineer at AWS, you will be working in a large, extremely complex and dynamic data warehousing environment. We are looking for someone with the uncanny ability to integrate multiple heterogeneous data sources like Adobe Site Catalyst, Adobe Target, Sales Force, Adobe Connect with AWS central data warehouse and build efficient, flexible, and scalable data warehouse and reporting solutions. You should be enthusiastic about learning new technologies and be able to implement solutions using these technologies to enable upgrades of the existing platform. You should have excellent business and communication skills and be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions, then build the data sets that answer those questions. You should be expert at designing, implementing, and operating stable, scalable, low cost solutions to flow data from production systems into the data warehouse and into end-user facing reporting applications. Above all you should be passionate about working with huge data sets and someone who loves to bring datasets together to answer business questions and drive growth. At AWS, you have control over every layer you build. Instead of owning a small slice of an existing service, you will own a core segment of a growing marketing platform serving 1000s of internal customers and millions of external customers. You will build on multiple AWS services and have opportunities to engage directly with those teams to improve our core offerings. At AWS, we work with our customers on a daily basis to prove out our ideas, gather feedback, and improve the platform. Graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related technical field.Experience with Amazon Redshift or other distributed computing technology.Industry experience as a Data Engineer or related specialty (e.g., Software Engineer, Business Intelligence Engineer, Data Scientist) with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets.Experience with AWS Tools and Technologies.Hands-on experience with cloud computing and UNIX/Linux based systems.Demonstrated ability to work effectively across various internal organizations.Excellent written and verbal communications skills.Amazon.com - 8 days ago - save job - report job - original jobApply NowApply On Company Sitesave this job aSave this jobData Engineer jobs in Vancouver, BCJobs at Amazon Web Services Canada in Vancouver, BCData Engineer salaries in Vancouver, BCCompany InfoFollowGet job updates from Amazon Web Services Canada, In. description: Data Scientist, Medical Imaging; Canada - Richmond, BC - Indeed.com Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData Scientist, Medical Imaging; CanadaChange Healthcare671 reviewsChange Healthcare671 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Richmond, BCTransforming the future of healthcare isnt something we take lightly. It takes teams of the best and the brightest, working together to make an impact. As one of the largest healthcare technology companies in the U.S., we are a catalyst to accelerate the journey toward improved lives and healthier communities. Here at Change Healthcare, were using our influence to drive positive changes across the industry, and we want motivated and passionate people like you to help us continue to bring new and innovative ideas to life. If youre ready to embrace your passion and do what you love with a company thats committed to supporting your future, then you belong at Change Healthcare. Pursue purpose. Champion innovation. Earn trust. Be agile. Include all. Empower Your Future. Make a Difference. Position Description The Data Scientist is a key contributor to the success of the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Medical Imaging team, the Imaging, Enterprise Imaging Solutions business unit, and Change Healthcare (CHC). This individual with versatile data science skills will create commercial-grade AI solutions for medical imaging products. He/she will participate to the optimization of our AI operations from data ingestion and machine learning modeling to integration into the end product. The AI Medical Imaging team is responsible for creating AI enabled solutions, maintaining a culture of innovation with a startup mindset, and providing subject matter expertise for the benefit of Change Healthcare. While the AI Medical Imaging team has stakeholders throughout the business unit, it works most closely with academic and industrial partners and those parts of the organization responsible for product conception, design and development. The Data Scientist will work with all stakeholders to fulfill Companys business needs. Responsibilities: Build and maintain large medical imaging databases Develop data cleaning and pre-processing methods to normalize data and detect outliers Optimize data transfer, data flows and data operations Implement and document APIs for machine learning algorithms Develop and deploy machine learning algorithms for medical imaging use cases Collaborate with academic and industrial partners to collect and optimize data collection Assist with product integration of machine learning solutions Assist in development of machine learning web/UI applications Minimum Requirement (Required): 5+ years in software development, preferably in medical imaging 5+ years of machine learning experience Critical Skills (Required): 5+ years of programming experience in Python, R, JS and C/C++ 5+ years of development in data modeling and machine learning, including practical experience of deep learning methods (CNN, RNN) and/or natural language processing 3+ years of experience in agile development 2+ year of experience with machine learning toolkits (TensorFlow, scikit-learn, Keras) 1+ years of experience with cloud-based storage and computing tools for machine learning Experience with at least one of the public cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, Azure or IBM Cloud Additional Knowledge & Skills (Preferred / Not Required): Experience developing commercial Web/UI applications Development experience with topological data analysis Experience in CI/CD tools Experience in automated functional/load/integration test tools Experience of declarative languages such as XML, JSON, and YAML Experience in Linux/Unix OS and shell scripting Soft Skills: Strong written and verbal communication, and interpersonal skills Highly self-motivated and directed. Results oriented Cross-cultural and team player who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment Education / Training: PhD or MS in computer science, electrical engineering or related discipline or equivalent industry experience. Physical Requirements: Limited domestic and international travel required (up to 5%). Job Description Duties and Responsibilities Define & implement customer data management methodologies that support STEMCELLs strategy around customer growth and retention. Own the team responsible for new customer onboarding, data maintenance, quality assurance, corporate & reporting hierarchy management, and change control. Partner with Marketing, Sales Operations, Customer Service, Finance & IT teams to define the data lifecycle of the customer at STEMCELL and deploy effective data acquisition, integration, management & mastering methodologies Define and lead data improvement programs used to advance content management operations Establish a workflow based service request process to document and implement data management tasks Define and deploy performance based metrics scorecards across the customer data operations pipeline to identify process risks and efficiency opportunities Work closely with data quality, metadata and lineage services to ensure conformance of content to enterprise data content, sourcing, and distribution standards Provide coaching and mentorship to Marketing, Sales Operations, Customer Service to improve operational excellence Maintain & catalog structured content intake, management and distribution processes Collaborate with IT to deploy appropriate tools & processes to support data entry, de-duplication, and mastering. Implement training and education program for customer data consumers to build balanced understanding and use of customer content Ensure compliance with internal data policies and external regulatory requirements Qualifications Minimum of 4 years of related experience in Data Scientist/Operations Master level functional depth of customer, master data in S/4 Experience working with enterprise platforms such as SFDC, and SQL Server strongly preferred S/4 data architecture and data modeling experience SAP Information Steward architect and data quality leadership and implementation experience Data cleansing implementation experience Experience defining systems strategy, developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines Strong interpersonal, verbal/written communication, organization and customer service skills Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and simultaneously manage multiple projects, priorities and deadlines; outstanding project management and time management skills Advanced knowledge of MS Office and G Suite applications STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as Scientists Helping Scientists  standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada. This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities. To apply please select the apply button. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account. You must set up an account in order to apply. Create an account by selecting the create account button. You will then be asked for your email and to create a password. Your Password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter, and a number.Once you have created your password you will be asked to upload your resume. Uploading your resume will provide the ability to auto-populate your application with information from your resume. If you prefer to manually complete all of the fields in the application you can do this by clicking next. You can upload your cover letter as an attachment in the attachments screen. description: Sr Data Engineer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchSr Data EngineerAMZN CAN Fulfillment Svcs, ULC38,092 reviewsAMZN CAN Fulfillment Svcs, ULC38,092 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Vancouver, BCDegree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or a related field (e.g. financial statistics etc).5+ years of Industry experience as a Data Engineer or related specialty (e.g. Software Engineer, Business Intelligence Engineer, and Data Scientist) with extensive professional experience and a proven track record in a role focused on understanding, manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.Significant experience in relational database concepts with an expert knowledge of SQL.Significant experience with relational and star schema data modeling concepts.Experience processing noSql dataDemonstrated ability in data modeling, ETL development, and Data warehousingCoding proficiency in at least one modern programming language.Experience with Linux systems command-line tools and scriptingExperience with Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Pig, Spark, etc.)Strong written and verbal English communication skills. The Mobile Growth teams mission is to create experiences that will inspire the customer to more deeply engage with the shopping app. The Mobile Growth Analytics team plays a critical role in building the foundational analytics infrastructure that powers the mobile shopping business, enables teams to personalize and optimize customer experiences based on engagement, and enables teams to better understand customer behavior. We innovate to unlock the potential of the organization to analyze customer behavior and have created a data lake and front end visualization platform that over 300 users rely on to better understand mobile customer behavior. Join us to directly shape and influence the future growth around Mobile @ Amazon! This role requires you to live at the cross section of data, engineering, and the mobile business. You have a deep understanding of data, analytical techniques, and how to connect insights to the business, and you have practical experience in insisting on highest standards on operations in ETL and big data pipelines. Your responsibilities include big data design and analysis, data modeling, and development, deployment, and operations of big data pipelines. You will work closely with the software development engineering team to fundamentally redesign the Mobile Metrics infrastructure. You will raise the bar for our engineers to better understand the data flows, infrastructure options, and innovate with them where the options do not meet our needs. You will be part of a broader cross-functional Mobile Growth Analytics team and problem solve together how we can improve how data unlocks value for customers. The Mobile Growth Analytics team is a fast paced environment where every day brings new challenges and new opportunities. As a Data Engineer working on the analytics platform, you will be implementing and supporting the analytic technologies that give our customers timely, flexible and structured access to their data. You will interact with customers to gather requirements and structure solutions. Design, implement and drive adoption of new analytic technologies and solutions. Promote industry standard best practices. Interface with business customers, gathering requirements and gaining a deep-dive understanding of key datasets. At Amazon you will see results from your work as the insights we generate will unlock new initiatives to improve the customer experience. We are looking for candidates that have strong computer science credentials, are customer-obsessed and have a track record of building quality solutions. You know how to build and you dive deep into data. You intrinsically use technology to solve problems, excel in data analysis and can succinctly and accurately report your findings. You will contribute to all aspects of our systems design, development, documentation, testing and operations. You will improve our data pipelines and mine new sources of data to make our system better. For this brand new initiate with highly-motivated engineers, you will help deliver robust data, feature sets, intuitive designs and user interfaces that will deliver a Mobile Analytics Platform at Amazon scale. Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing of large data sets.Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including implementation and tuning experience using AWS technologies  Redshift,S3,EC2 etc and Hadoop, Hbase, Hive, Pig and other big data technologies.Experience building data products incrementally and integrating and managing datasets from multiple sources.Experience with OBIEE, Business Objects, Cognos, Tableau, MicroStrategy, etc. BI packages.Familiarity with ETL such as Informatica.Experience using machine learning and statistical tools such as Python/Pandas, R, SPSS, Weka etc .Experience providing technical leadership and mentoring other engineers.Experience working in small teams and shipping products, building and developing both system prototypes and operating scalable software systems.Linux/UNIX including to process large data sets.Cloud computing, large-scale and high-availability distributed architecture.Strong analytical and excellent problem solving skills.
