description: Digital Marketing Director - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com Find jobsCompany reviewsFind salariesUpload your resumeSign in|EnFr|Employers / Post Job whatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchDigital Marketing DirectorBosa Properties6 reviewsBosa Properties6 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Vancouver, BCAbout the Company At Bosa, we are all united by the common goal of building customers for life. Although were best known for our work in development, contracting, and asset management, our diverse brands deliver far more than just real estate. Our fully-integrated, in-house team takes a 360-degree approach to understanding the customer across all touchpoints, and with over 50 years of experience working in the local market, our family-run company has learned a thing or two along the way. Our experience has earned us a reputation for quality, integrity, and innovation, and we are proud to be considered one of Canadas most respected privately-owned brands. Bosa is proud to have been named an Aon Best Employer for 2017 and 2018, ranking among the top 1/4 of all Canadian employers based on engagement, leadership, performance culture and employment brand. About the Role As the Digital Marketing Director, you will lead the development and execution of all digital marketing activities. With over six years of data-driven, digital marketing experience, you will be the driver behind all digital marketing initiatives across our brands. You will: Champion the use of data analytics and transform the way we look at data-driven marketing; Manage and build on all external vendors relationships with the digital marketing space; Collaborate with senior leadership to drive customer-oriented digital marketing initiatives; Operate as the leader within the marketing department and serve as the digital marketing expert for the company. What you Bring The ideal candidate is a highly organized, self-starter who is a data scientist with creative flair. This individual will have an innate curiosity and desire to learn, and will take a hands-on approach to transforming the way Bosa executes digital marketing across its diverse range of projects and brands. Our Must Haves: At least six (6) years of relevant digital marketing experience; Experience in digital media planning and buying; Experience with Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and SEO best practices; Strong knowledge of ad technologies and marketing attribution techniques; Strong data visualization and reporting skills; Proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights; Experience leading and mentoring small teams; Ability to confidently explain technical concepts to stakeholders at varying levels; Excellent Verbal and written skills in English and Mandarin is an advantage; Experience using Pardot and Salesforce is an advantage; Experience in Chinese digital marketing channels, such as WeChat, is an advantage. Your Rewards: Our most important offering to anyone that joins the Bosa Properties team is our culture of innovation and ownership. We bring out the best in each other by constantly striving to be world class in all we do. These values are reflected in our Real Estate Projects, our Company, and our People. At Bosa, we also offer a very competitive compensation structure that supplements your regular income with a robust benefits package: MSP, Medical and Dental Coverage: Our industry leading benefits package covers you and your dependents at no cost RRSP Matching: We support your future goals by matching up to 5% of your RRSP contributions. Friends and Family Program: Early and exclusive access to our newly released projects Bosa Connect: Our annual development conference that is designed and hosted by our leadership and complemented by a range of world-class speakers and workshop experts. Professional Development and Education Support Interested? Awesome  we cant wait to hear from you. Please submit an application using the link provided. We value your interest in the Bosa Family of Companies. BrainStation Educators have the unique opportunity to teach, research, and work on real analysis problems, while simultaneously building the future of higher education. Whether it's our industry-leading cloud-based practice management platform ( https://www.clio.com/suite ), our legal client relationship management (CRM), ( https://www.clio.com/grow/ ) our ground-breaking Legal Trends Report ( http://clio.com/resources/legal-trends/ ) or our ever-popular Clio Cloud Conference ( http://cliocloudconference.com/ ), Clio is at the forefront of advancing the legal sphere. With the help of the cloud, we make lawyers' lives simpler and help them better organize and manage their legal practices. As one of Canada's fastest-growing companies with international reach, we employ over 400 individuals with a rapidly growing customer base spanning 90 countries. Clio has been recognized as one of CIX's Top 20 Most Influential Technology Companies ( https://techvibes.com/2017/09/07/the-20-most-innovative-tech-companies-in-canada ), one of Canada's Top Small & Medium Employers ( https://www.clio.com/pressrelease/clio-recognized-as-one-of-canadas-top-small-medium-employers/ ) for three years in a row ( https://content.eluta.ca/top-employer-clio ), and has one of Canada's 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures ( https://www.clio.com/pressrelease/clio-recognized-admired-corporate-culture-canada/ ). Additionally, for the last two years, we have been recognized on Deloitte's Fast50 Fast500 lists and were awarded Tech Culture of the Year ( http://dailyhive.com/vancouver/technology-impact-awards-2018 ) and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies ( https://www2.deloitte.com/ca/en/pages/canadas-best-managed-companies/articles/best-managed-winners-2019.html ) in 2019. Our Data Science team is focused on stewarding a scientific culture that makes better decisions and learns from experience. You will be working alongside the Director of Data Insights to help leaders across departments develop and deploy data-driven insights. You will help our business grow, help our customers succeed, and continuously improve the way we operate. Who You Are: We aren't looking for just any traditional Data Scientist to join this team. We're looking for someone who takes data seriously, thrives in a rapid-growth, high-velocity environment, and someone who lives and breathes their values. We're looking for an innovator and a thought leader! We're looking for someone who is: Always looking to innovate with data and explore open-ended questions; Strategically minded and never shies away from a challenge; Passionate about approaching things empirically; Self-motivated and able to work autonomously and collaboratively; Agile and responsive, and comfortable with constant change; Here's what you'll need to do: Performing deep research and analysis into open-ended business questions, developing novel hypotheses, and communicating results to stakeholders to drive action; Identifying new questions about our business, product, and customers and proposing research projects; Collaborating with stakeholders to develop research, hypotheses, and experiments that drive results; Making essential business data available and usable for new analysis; Innovating new techniques in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data mining to unlock opportunities in the business; Supporting a scientific culture by enabling discussions with data, disseminating best practices, and leading by example. You should have: Undergraduate or graduate degree in a relevant discipline (computing science, statistics, etc.) 2+ years applied experience in data science; Proficient in database modelling, SQL, and data warehousing principles; Proficient in developing analysis in Python, R, or a similar language; Self-motivated, creative and lives a learning mindset; Excellent written and verbal communication skills; Comfortable working independently and making key decisions on projects. Serious bonus points if you: Have experience with large data sets Have experience driving change through evidence-based decision making Researching open-ended questions in a scientific matter that are related to the business Why Clio? We could talk to you about our ping pong table, beer taps, yoga classes, and nap room, but, we know you're looking for more than that. Instead, here are a few of the things that set us apart and make us the employer of choice for top talent in Canada and beyond: The chance to do work that matters on a product that truly changes lives ( http://clio.com/customers ). This is the place for driven people who want to make their mark. The freedom to choose your own path (and change it) to build a meaningful career that works for you. Excellent health and dental coverage, 4 weeks vacation time, parental leave options and education spending An RRSP matching program Regular games nights and team outings with the best coworkers you'll ever work with Diversity and Inclusion We believe that ensuring diversity and inclusion will produce a better place to work and a better product. description: Senior Economist or FSS Senior Analyst (2018-2019 PhD Job Market) - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com Find JobsCompany ReviewsFind SalariesFind ResumesEmployers / Post JobUpload your resumeSign inwhatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchSenior Economist or FSS Senior Analyst (2018-2019 PhD Job Market)Bank of Canada48 reviews-Ottawa, ONBank of Canada48 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Ottawa, ONTake a central role The Bank of Canada has a vision to be a leading central bankdynamic, engaged and trustedcommitted to a better Canada. No other employer in the country offers you the unique opportunity to work at the very centre of Canadas economy, in an organization with significant impact on the economic and financial well-being of all Canadians. You will be challenged, energized and motivated to excel in an environment where we are reinventing central banking, renewing ways of doing business and reinforcing a culture of innovation. Find out more about the Banks current research priorities, explore the broad range of staff research that our people have the intellectual freedom to pursue, and learn about the ways in which the Bank supports and collaborates with the external research community. Application Process Your application must include the following: cover letter curriculum vitae research paper(s) or job market paper three letters of recommendation Requests for additional information and the letters of recommendation should be sent by email to phd_recruitment@bankofcanada.ca. The letters of recommendation should be sent by your referees. To apply, click on the link above or visit www.bankofcanada.ca/careers. Application deadline Applications will continue to be accepted until all positions are filled. We will conduct interviews at the following conferences: Canadian Economics Employment Exchange (CEEE) (December 7  8, 2018) Allied Social Science Association (AEA/AFA) (January 4-6, 2019). If you wish to be considered for an interview at one of these conferences, you must apply at least one month before the conference, when review of applications will begin. Your future responsibilities You will support the economic and financial welfare of Canadians and contribute to the Banks work at an international level. You will take part in leading-edge analysis, which supports the Bank in its functional areas, and collaborate with your colleagues within the Bank and at other organizations in Canada and abroad. Subject to the needs and interests of the Bank and the employee, senior economists or senior analysts may move to other Bank departments to pursue research of relevance in new or needed areas. More specifically, you will be expected to participate in the conduct of monetary policy, help promote the safety and efficiency of our financial and payment systems, assist in managing the governments public debt programs and foreign exchange reserves, and support the design, issuance and distribution of Canadas bank notes develop leading-edge research ideas and produce high-quality research papers related to the broad responsibilities of the Banks functional areas conduct policy analysis and brief senior management on matters related to the responsibilities of the functional areas collaborate with colleagues within the Bank and from other organizations to develop research ideas, as well as produce and disseminate research build relationships with external parties, e.g., government and international agencies, other central banks, financial market participants and organizations, and outside academics, to share knowledge, research and analysis Your education a recent (completed after 1 January 2011) or forthcoming (completed in 2019) PhD in economics or finance Your knowledge and skills We will evaluate your application against the key requirements listed below and your education, which must be demonstrated in your cover letter, curriculum vitae, three letters of recommendation, and research paper(s) or job market paper. If you are selected for an interview, you may be evaluated through two interviews, a written assessment and a presentation of your job market paper. Key requirements research skills: the ability to undertake in-depth and high quality research projects that are publishable in top-tier, peer-reviewed academic journals of the Banks functional areas fields of expertise: through research in one or more of the following relevant areas of research, depending on specific needs macroeconomics and monetary economics banking and payment systems digital economy international economics global commodity markets financial economics financial markets and institutions labour and demographic economics mathematical and quantitative methods industrial organization law and economics economic networks writing skills: the ability to produce effective written documents in a style and form likely to appeal to and influence the intended audience oral communication and presentation skills: the ability to make effective, well-structured presentations adapted to the intended audience, inside or outside the Bank, and the ability to communicate effectively with others by demonstrating active listening skills and conveying information clearly teamwork and collaboration: the ability to work independently and collaboratively innovation: the ability to create new insights, devise novel approaches and make innovative decisions through research information using empirical and/or modelling skills analytical and technical skills: strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to analyze complex economic and financial Language requirement: English or French essential In exceptional circumstances, an equivalent combination of a PhD and research experience in an area of current particular relevance or interest to the Bank not listed above may be considered. Research support, collaboration and development The Bank of Canada is committed to employee growth and career development and supports employees in reaching their full potential within their roles. As part of the career path in this position, it is possible to progress to a role with an expanded scope at a higher job grade, and a corresponding salary increase, if specific criteria are met. Travel for external presentations of ongoing research is centrally funded and managed by a committee comprised of Senior Researchers. Additional funding may be available for working with co-authors, invited discussions, or attending high-profile conferences. Support provided by Research Assistants who help gather data, conduct statistical analysis, and prepare materials for presentations and a talented team of administrative, computer, data-scientist, editorial, design, and library professionals. Access to numerous data sources, including confidential and administrative data and powerful computing capabilities, including the cluster. A variety of vehicles for external distribution of research and analytical work. These include, personal web pages, Staff Working Paper series, Staff Discussion Paper series, Staff Analytical Notes series, and Technical Reports. Many opportunities to interact and exchange ideas, provide feedback on ongoing research, and collaborate on research projects with economists from top economic departments and major institutions, with potential referees, and journal editors by offering: a steady stream of research conferences, workshops, and visiting speaker seminars throughout the year including the Fellowship Program and the Visiting Scholar Program. the opportunity to work along side several Special Advisers whose role is to enhance the research efforts and policy advice by providing guidance on joint research projects (i.e. commenting on papers and policy documents). What you can expect from us This is a great opportunity to join a leading organization and be part of a high-performing team. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package designed to meet your needs at every stage of your life and career. Salary The Bank offers a competitive total compensation package that is reviewed annually. The starting base salaries are based on qualifications and range annually between Can$103,120 and Can$137,494. Hiring bonus You may be eligible for a hiring bonus payable as a lump sum payment at time of hire and up to three annual additional payments to a total maximum of up to 30% of your base salary. Performance pay You may be eligible for performance pay for successfully meeting, exceeding expectations or far exceeding expectations (7 to 20% of your base salary). Additional Benefits Flexible and comprehensive benefits so you can choose the level of health, dental, disability and life and/or accident insurance coverage that meets your needs Extra vacation days (up to five each year) that you can purchase to add to your vacation entitlement Indexed, defined-benefit pension plan For more information on key benefits, please visit www.bankofcanada.ca/careers/working-here. Additional information Priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents Must be eligible for reliability status or secret clearance Relocation assistance may be provided, if required Contact information: recruitment@bankofcanada.ca Number of available positions: 18 Work address: 234 Wellington Street West, Ottawa, ON K1A 0G9 Position Type: Regular We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.Bank of Canada - 4 months ago - save job - report job - original jobApply NowApply On Company SiteSave this jobOther jobs you may likeDirector, Business Analysis & Policy DevelopmentBank of CanadaOttawa, ONBank of Canada-11 days agoPrincipal Analyst, Retail Payments StrategyBank of CanadaOttawa, ONBank of Canada-19 days agoSenior Data Scientist / FintechBrain FinanceMontral, QCEasily apply14 days agoDIRECTOR, ECONOMIC AND FISCAL ANALYSISLegislative AssemblyToronto, ON$130,930 - $164,930 a yearOntario Public Service-12 days agoSee more recommended jobsSenior Economist jobs in Ottawa, ONJobs at Bank of Canada in Ottawa, ONSenior Economist salaries in Ottawa, ONCompany InfoFollowGet job updates from Bank of Canada. description: Data Scientist - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.ca Find JobsCompany ReviewsFind SalariesFind ResumesEmployers / Post JobUpload your resumeSign inwhatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData ScientistMindBridge Ai-Ottawa, ONOttawa, ONData Scientist Data is at the heart of what we do at MindBridge, we are looking for people who enjoy partnering with colleagues and clients to answer critical and difficult questions. Our data scientists and engineers do not inhabit Ivory Towers, they are collaborative problem-solvers. We care most about getting to the best point of view, regardless of whether that requires a rigorous statistical model, a simplistic ad hoc approach, or some combination of multiple lenses. Do you have an enquiring mind that questions orthodoxy and the status-quo? Do you enjoy the challenge of breaking new ground in a highly dynamic environment thats part of one of the fastest growing industries? If so, MindBridge is the team for you! Skills that will get you hired: Data Visualization and Communication: You know that storytelling with data is an important skill. You understand how to communicate analytic insights to everyday people without resorting to jargon. Science/Statistics: You are not scared by Greek letters, and have empirical thinking at your core. You may have acquired these skills by studying Math, statistics or you have a scientific or engineering background. Statisticians, Biologists, Chemists or Physicists. Machine Learning: Youve used machine learning techniques, you know how logistic regression works and you can jump in and train a neural net model on data and understand if your results are any good. Data Munging: You know how to work with data, shape it and manipulate it at will. Wizarding skills with data are highly desirable and knowledge of one or all of SQL, Apache Spark, TensorFlow, MatLab, R is an advantage. Software Engineering: You are comfortable writing high-quality code in a professional setting. You should have some experience writing code and have worked on agile development teams. Additional Skills Strong skills in Java, Scala, R, Python or SQL is an asset Experience in analytics with machine learning models is an asset People were looking for : Have an enquiring mind, you are collaborative and like working with colleagues and clients to change the world. Have the ability to think strategically, self-direct and believe in bringing their best every day. Have 5 Years Experience translating data into insight to recommendations Have a BS (MS/PhD Preferred) in quant discipline (e.g. Math/Hard Science, Stats, CS, EE, Econ) Requirements: Eligibility for Government of Canada Secret Level (II) clearance is contingent on employment About the company At MindBridge we believe in augmenting human potential through the use of analytics, machine learning, and AI. We believe the best forms of actionable insights come from collaboration between AI and users. At MindBridge we are building the worlds first AI financial auditor. Our technology supports evidence-based decision making built on a bedrock of data analysis and data science. If you thrive in a culture of healthy debate and enjoy flipping seamlessly between the strategic big picture and the nuts and bolts, then we want to hear from you. Financial crimes are on the rise; the loss today is estimated in the trillions of dollars. MindBridge was formed to address the growing problem that there is too much data and not enough insight. Its high time that we take analytics to the boardroom and into the audit space to fight fraud. If you are looking for a needle in a haystack our technology can find it, even if its a haystack of needles. We use statistical methods, machine learning, and artificial intelligence all wrapped in an easy to use cloud-based platform. We make complicated analysis simple and easy for non-technical professionals. If tackling these kinds of problems gets you fired up, lets talk. Work with us and we can bring early detection of financial misconduct to the world can stop good people from turning bad. MindBridge is passionate and committed to creating a diverse environment. We are an equal opportunity employer and as such qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. description: Data Scientist - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.ca Find JobsCompany ReviewsFind SalariesFind ResumesEmployers / Post JobUpload your resumeSign inwhatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData ScientistThinkwrap Commerce-Ottawa, ONOttawa, ONWho is Pivotree? Pivotree is a privately-held and venture backed company with an aggressive growth objective including strategic acquisitions. 2018 was a transformational year for Pivotree with the combination of three existing businesses in this sector: Tenzing, ThinkWrap and Spark:Red. Our combined team is made up of a diverse blend of engineers, solution architects, programmers, UI developers, project managers and analysts who work together to create and manage next-generation commerce excellence. We hold ourselves to the very highest standards and our employees take great pride in our accomplishments. The current rate and magnitude of technological change places our clients at a crossroads: keep up or get left behind. We see the vast and complex relationship between commerce, technology and people and how it might connect us more deeply and meaningfully in the future. The journey to that great ambition, however, will not be linear or quick. It will require constant course correction and vigilant adaptation to an ever-changing technological landscape. We help merchants, manufacturers, retailers and lifestyle business ADAPT RELENTLESSLY. Pivotree architects, builds, hosts and manages a wide range of commerce experiences for well-known domestic and global brands. Customers turn to Pivotree as their trusted partner when they want to grow revenue, increase online and in-store traffic, improve customer experience, grow a loyal customer base, achieve operational efficiencies, and higher profits. The Challenge As a data scientist on the H3 Innovation and Technology team, youll be helping to create new products, which will directly impact some of our current clients complex problems as well as being on the edge of innovation by working on tomorrows problem today. The right candidate will have amazing analytical and majestic machine learning modelling abilities, communication skills (verbal and non verbal), business acumen, and is quite technically savvy in terms of not only knowing domain specific knowledge, but can also learn the latest and greatest in innovation. They will have a passion for applying their skillset to understand data and all of its glory. They will also love getting their hands dirty with data by being able to investigate, model, and present all their findings to both of the sides of the bench - the development team and the functional users/business stakeholders. They will be able to handle multiple tasks without dropping the ball and can communicate if the workload is too light or too heavy. The Scope Select with reasoning, implement, test, and tune statistical, predictive and machine learning models. Ensure data quality throughout all stages, including collection from the source, source of truth generation, normalization, sanitization, and transformation. Develop, train, and share best ML/AI best practices with rest of Pivotree organization. Identify, research, build new use cases and opportunities for ML/AI in our target categories. Creative in finding new solutions/designing innovative methods, systems, and processes. Explain technical processes to a wide audience that includes both internal and external clients, and define and translate business objectives into actionable work items Your Qualifications - The hard Skills Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence or something similar. 1+ year of experience with version control system - specifically Git and/or GitHub. 1+ year of experience with NoSQL databases - specifically Mongo, Cassandra 1+ year of experience in Analytics or other quantitative disciplines. 2+ years professional experience with modeling and analysis including machine learning, statistical analysis, operations research and management science and data mining. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Proficient in many of the following applied analytical techniques - clustering, regression analysis, SVM, neural networks, collaborative filtering, KNN, association rules, decision trees, or similar. Experience with Python including familiarity with the SparkML, NumPy, pandas, and scikit-learn libraries Solid hands-on experience with Python and programming, however, a guru level is not needed since only a general level of understandability of the code is desired. Basic familiarity with core AWS services - specifically S3, RDS, and EC2. Subject matter expert in at least 1 of the following core areas: Artificial Intelligence, Cognitive Science, Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Natural Language Processing, or Graphical models Being able to visualize data with tools such: mathplotlib, plotly, bokeh Your Qualifications - The Soft Skills Language requirements? English is mandatory, Spanish is an asset, French is nice. You are: entrepreneurial, driven, collaborative and passionate about IT transformation in the retail industry Able to demonstrate business leadership through a technology lens and strive for industry leadership You ask why until you fully understand the business problem and love exploring new domains. Youre used to working with abstract data, and you love discovering new narratives in unmined data lakes. You embrace working with team members around the globe, in various time zones, multiple disciplines, and from various cultures. Takes responsibility for an initiative, works with minimal direction and gets things done even when assignments are vague or undefined. Preferred Experience Masters Degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence or something similar. AWS Cloud Practitioner Certified Knowledge and experience with Agile development practices. Experience in eCommerce, Supply Chain, Retail, manufacturing, or healthcare Hands-on experience with using extrinsic data (weather, geography, social) along with corporate managed data Hands-on experience in feasibility and estimation for future projects/initiatives Experience with DL frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, MXNet) and application of DL libraries to NLP Understand data modelling, metadata knowledge for both structured and non-structured data Experience working in a collaborative, distributed, cross-functional environment If you believe that you can make a significant contribution to our team, we would love to hear from you. As part of your application, please attach a resume with detailed work history and a cover letter that explains how you will contribute to our culture and why you may be the ideal candidate.ThinkWrap Commerce - 10 days ago - save job - report job - original jobApply NowApply On Company SiteSave this jobOther jobs you may likeData ScientistInterset Software IncOttawa, ONEasily apply8 days agoStaff Developer - Data, Insights teamShopifyOttawa, ONShopify-11 days agoData EngineerMD Financial ManagementOttawa, ONMD Financial Management-10 days agoData Scientist and Modeler, Industry EconomicsThe Conference Board of CanadaOttawa, ONThe Conference Board of Canada-30+ days agoData AnalystMD Financial ManagementOttawa, ONMD Financial Management-10 days agoSee more recommended jobsData Scientist jobs in Ottawa, ONJobs at Thinkwrap Commerce in Ottawa, ONData Scientist salaries in Ottawa, ONCompany InfoFollowGet job updates from Thinkwrap Commerce. description: Data Scientist - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com Find JobsCompany ReviewsFind SalariesFind ResumesEmployers / Post JobUpload your resumeSign inwhatjob title, keywords, or companywherecity or provinceFind jobsAdvanced Job SearchData ScientistCommunications Security Establishment5 reviews-Ottawa, ONCommunications Security Establishment5 reviewsRead what people are saying about working here.Ottawa, ONReference number: 48123-CSE(OC)2019 Closing Date: 2020-03-31 Job Summary **The big picture** CSE plays a critical role in the implementation of Canadas cyber security strategy. To carry out our mission we track cyberthreats around the world, monitor Government of Canada networks to detect and mitigate cyberthreats, and protect information of value to the government. CSEs data analysts/scientists play a crucial role in generating insight from data-rich environments. *Whats in it for you?* Are you interested in a unique working experience applying data analyst/science skills to a diverse variety of cyber defence problems? At CSE, data analysts and data scientists are motivated by an environment with: interesting and distinct problems to solve talented colleagues encouragement to approach problems from different perspectives continuous learning and development to maintain a technical edge opportunities to see the impact of their efforts If the above description sounds attractive, you should consider CSE for a career in data analysis/science. Data analysts perform data review, data validation, quality control, and cleaning; they develop and evolve Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and data models; they create data processing pipelines to analyze disparate multi-source data; they prepare technical documentation and standard operating procedures; and they ensure data requirements are met for operational reporting, dashboards and ad hoc requests. Data scientists model real world problems to forecast what might happen; they apply and develop machine learning techniques, they implement algorithms in efficient and scalable ways; they communicate analytical results to others in compelling and visual ways; they help to develop scalable solutions; and they mentor others and help others to communicate and gain understanding about data science. Position type: Term and indeterminate positions, with a one (1) year probation period. Salary Range: UNI 07 level: $78,001 - $91,764 UNI 08 level: $83,250 - $97,942 These positions are currently eligible for a market allowance ranging from an additional $8,366 to $11,000. Position Requirements Education University degree with extensive statistical, computational coursework; for example, physics, math, engineering, economics, data science, computer science, bioinformatics, etc. (preference may be given to those with a graduate degree). Experience Experience with extract, transform, load (ETL) activities including cleaning, transforming, and ingesting large, variegated and changing structured and unstructured data Experience working with databases and database management tools Experience scripting or programming in at least one open-source programming language (e.g. Python) or a statistical software package (e.g. R) Experience collaborating with management, software tool developers and software tool users Asset Extensive (three years or more) background in software programming or scripting Experience in developing and applying computational algorithms and statistical methods to find patterns and model, and predict relationships in large, disparate and evolving data sets Experience in applying and improving machine learning techniques Experience conducting data analysis and creating compelling communications in visual, verbal and written forms Language Requirements English Essential Who Can Apply Canadian citizens who can qualify for a Top Secret security clearance conforming to CSEs standards. Security Requirements Candidates must have no criminal record. The screening process involves a security interview, a polygraph test, a psychological assessment, and a background investigation covering a minimum of your last 10 years history, including credit and financial verifications. Ongoing substance abuse is a factor to be assessed as part of your screening process. How To Apply Applicants must clearly demonstrate in their application how they meet each EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE criteria. Failure to do so will result in the applicant being screened out of the selection process. Notes CSE is a separate organization and is not subject to the Public Service Employment ACT (PSEA). The organization has its own values-based staffing regime and as such, has the flexibility to determine qualifications for positions and how these positions will be assessed in a selection process. CSE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage applications from women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minority groups. CSEC offers an assessment process which will accommodate the needs of persons with disabilities. If you may need such accommodation, please advise us. Candidates must be able to provide proof of education credentials. A written test will be used as a screening tool. An interview and references will follow for candidates who are successful on the screening test. The entire selection process  tests, interviews, security investigation  may take more than one year. You will serve as their ambassador within CaseWare, to identify and support sales and business-development opportunities, to advocate for new CaseWare products and technologies and to develop and manage strong relationships with clients and industry experts. The Industry Strategist will help represent and support the Internal, External, IT, Government and Academic audit markets across all of the CaseWare IDEA and the CaseWare Analytics portfolio. You will also use IDEAs technology stack, including Python, IDEAScript and SmartAnalyzer to develop new analytics capabilities that support the CaseWare user community. You will write user stories and the requirements, test and publish apps and making sure that the team is developing the right things by interacting frequently with them in a dynamic environment. You are also particularly adept at explaining how to address complex audit challenges using CaseWares technology.
